abstract: New York City Council is expected to pass eight bills that will curb policing practice known as broken windows, and will soften police department's stance toward minor infractions like public urination and drinking alcohol in public; move is meant to ease burden on criminal court system, and to counter alienation of many city residents by allowing many infractions to be handled by civil process.
lead_paragraph: The measures would affect low-level offenses such as littering, public urination and public consumption of alcohol, in some cases removing them from the criminal justice system.

headline.main: New York City Is Set to Adopt New Approach on Policing Minor Offenses
headline.print_headline: New York Is Set for a New Tack on Little Crimes

snippet: The measures would affect low-level offenses such as littering, public urination and public consumption of alcohol, in some cases removing them from the criminal justice system.
